main event: A plant chemist observed a bright, massive object in the sky resembling a flying saucer on July 11, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as being as bright as a star and moved rapidly out of sight in 2 minutes., The witness reported the sighting to the U.S. Coast Guard, who could not identify it., The report was referred to the National Aeronautics & Space Administration for further investigation., The sighting raised concerns due to its short duration and flight path inconsistency with recognized aircraft., The witness had previous experiences with unidentified aerial phenomena.
sighted object: a bright massive object in the sky
witness description: T. Hunckle, a plant chemist at Dow Chemical Co.
